original_title: Tense situation after Lanka Phosphate Company employee tries to attack executive in presence of State Minister
original_body_lines: A tense situation prevailed when Industries State Minister Chamara Sampath Dasanayake visited the Sri Lanka State Phosphate Company in Eppawala for an inspection yesterday.

The tense situation reportedly arose when an employee attempted to attack an executive officer in the presence of the State Minister after a group of employees tried to expose the fraud and corruption in the company.
However, the situation was thwarted by the intervention of the Police.
The employees alleged that the company has incurred a massive loss by importing a sparepart to a grinding machine that the company does not need.
The State Minister inquired as to why the relevant sparepart was not replaced despite the full amount being paid. He ordered the officer who placed the order to be brought before him.

The Supplies Officer had told the Minister that it was brought from a Chinese company and they had later found that it was different to the existing one, and the serial number was also different and that he cannot take the responsibility for this.

Then the State Minister told Lanka Phosphate Chairman Sandhya Ambanwala to sack the relevant officer. But the concerned officer had told the Minister that the decision to import the item had been taken by the Tender Board.

The Supplies Officer who faced the relevant incident has lodged a complaint with the Eppawala police station that he was assaulted by an employee in the presence of the State Minister. (Darshana Sanjeewa Balasuriya)
